msContents.colophon: 161vb: ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየሲኖዶስ፡ ስረዩ፡ ሊተ፡ ወባርኩኒ፡ ዘጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘአጽሐፎ፡ ንቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ በምንግ<ሥ>ተ፡ ሰማት[sic]። በስመ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወሀብክዋ፡ ለዛቲ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ አነ፡ ስምዖን፡ ቄሰ፡ ገበዝ፡ ለዛቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቤተ፡ ሐ[ዋርያት?]፡ ወሀብክዋ፡ ለ፲ወ፪፡ ሐዋርያት… Written in a secondary hand, partly readable. The note states that Sǝmʿon, qesa gabaz of the church Beta Ḥawāryāt, donated the book to the church of the 12 Apostles.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. is worn. The boards and leaves are heavily affected by humidity and mould. The board attachment, sewing are damaged. The last three fols. are misplaced: 164-165 should have been placed between fols. 1 and 2. Some fols. are heavily damaged, e.g. fols. 1, 161,165,166. Some fols. are damaged by water, e.g. fols. 1-9, 149-160. Tears carefully amended on 74, 95, 100, 156.

layout.ab: Pricking is mostly visible; ruling is partly visible.
The upper line is usually written above the ruling (frequently also below the ruling, cp. 96-99, 108-111, 115, 116, etc.)
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
A few bottom ruling lines are not used in some fols., e.g. 4r.
The columns (and margins) are frequently of irregular size; the scribes (esp. hand a) frequently disregarded the ruling; columns are frequently of somewhat irregular size.

handNote.seg: Hand a: poor. Hands b, c: careful.

Incipit of Text I and its sections; number, title and incipit of canons; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit page of Text I and of its sections, a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

handDesc.handNote: Hand c: 31r-v, 34r-v, 42vb. Hand c corrected and made addition to Text I-1 and I-2 written in hand a: e.g. on 41va, 41vb, 42vb.

list.item:
f. 33va: Record concerning a land grant (?).
Written in a more recent hand, 17th or 18th cent. (?)

- The title ሲኖዶስ is written on the front board. - Use of compressed script: 31rv, 34rv, 42vb, 116rb-117vb. - The text is written over extensive erasure: 40v, 42vb (canon of the biblical books?). - Cues for the rubricator (numerals, written sometimes in tiny size and thin strokes, but sometimes in regular size): 63-66va, 95v, 159r-160r. - Small crosses mostly of simple form, sometimes of sophisticated form, or tiny lines separating the words, might indicate the process of correction or preparation for inserting text dividers: 139v, 140r, 147v. - Some parchment leaves are produced rather crudely.

binding.decoNote: Two thick wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires (e.g. 86v-87r), one close to the head, one close to the tail.
